line.hiragana: えがお|が|とまらない
line.kanji: 笑顔|が|止まらない
line.english: I can't stop smiling
line.explained: smile|ga - used as a maker for the word before it, similar to wa but with more emphasis on the subject (also if the subject is unknown to the speaker) (See Tae Kim's Japanese guide at bottom for more info)|negative form of stop (tomaru=to stop, nai=negative part placed at end)

line.hiragana: おどる|ココロ|とまらない
line.kanji: 踊る|ココロ|止まらない
line.english: My heart won't stop dancing
line.explained: pounding - more common use is "dance"|heart, can also mean soul|negative form of stop again

line.hiragana: うごきだす|よ|きみ|の|もと|へ
line.kanji: 動き出す|よ|君|の|元|へ
line.english: and so I start to move towards you
line.explained: begin to move|yo is a way of directing a statement at another person, like saying "I'm going to move towards you, you know"|you|no - indicates possession, most commonly associated with ('s) on the end of a word|moto - location or origin|e - can also be "he", a particle which marks a location where you or something is going, in this case, marking 'you' as the location they're heading towards

line.hiragana: はしれ！|はしれ！|はしれ！
line.kanji: 走れ!|走れ!|走れ!
line.english: and run! Run! Run!
line.explained: hashire - form of to run (hashiru) exchanging ru to re is the imperative form of the verb, telling someone to run, this is true for most verbs ending in -ru

line.romaji: Zutto kimi wo onaji densha de miru tabi ni
line.hiragana: ずっと|キミ|を|おなじ|でんしゃ|で|みる|たび|に
line.kanji: ずっと|キミ|を|同じ|電車|で|見る|たび|に
line.english: I always see you on the same train as me
line.explained: always|you|wo - marks you as the one being looked at, more generally marks the word before it as the destination of the following action|same|train|de - particle that can be translated as 'at'|see|journey|ni - particle that can be translated as 'on'

line.hiragana: いつ|から|だろう?
line.kanji: いつ|から|だろう?
line.english: I wonder when it began,
line.explained: when|from|wonder - as in 'I wonder', means 'think' generally

line.romaji: Boku no kokoro no naka de ookiku natteita omoi
line.hiragana: ぼく|の|ココロ|の|なか|で|おおきく|なっていた|おもい
line.kanji: 僕|の|ココロ|の|中|で|大きく|なっていた|想い
line.english: when these feelings inside my heart became so big
line.explained: I|no - particle meaning possession turning I to my in this case|heart/soul|'no' again. Sentence so far reads "my heart's"|inside|de - at/in (points to location of action)|big/large|form of naru (to become), - tteita = past progressive conjugation of verb (for most -ru verbs)|feelings, can also mean thoughts or love

line.hiragana: はなしかける|こと|も|できなくて|いつも
line.kanji: 話しかける|こと|も|出来なくて|いつも
line.english: unable to ever start a conversation
line.explained: hanashi - conversation, kakeru - make a call|thing|also/too|to do (dekiru) made negative|always

line.romaji: tomodachi to issho ni shabetteru furi de
line.hiragana: ともだち|と|いっしょ|に|しゃべってる|ふり|で
line.kanji: 友達|と|一緒|に|喋ってる|ふり|で
line.english: I always pretended to talk with my friends
line.explained: friends|with|together|ni as in to|talk|pretend|marks where they were for next line

line.hiragana: よこめ|で|みてた|ぼく|だけど
line.kanji: 横目|で|見てた|僕|だけど
line.english: whilst watching you from the corner of my eye
line.explained: glance from corner of eye|points to where they looked from|looked|I|though

line.hiragana: きづいた|この|かんじょう|に
line.kanji: 気付いた|この|感情|に
line.english: now that I've noticed these feelings
line.explained: Noticed|these|feelings|points to this phrase in preperation for the next line

line.hiragana: もう|こうかい|なんて|したくない
line.kanji: もう|後悔|なんて|したくない
line.english: I don't want to regret anything anymore
line.explained: now, in this case better represented as 'no more'|regret|things like|to do (suru) but negative

line.romaji: boku wa boku ni uso tsuite nigetaku mo nai
line.hiragana: ぼく|は|ぼく|に|ウソ|ついて|にげたく|も|ない
line.kanji: 僕|は|僕|に|ウソ|ついて|逃げたく|も|ない
line.english: I don't want to lie to myself or run away from it
line.explained: I|points to I (me)|I (so far, I to I)|points to *I to myself*|lie|about|to run (nigeru) past tense|also|not (also don't want to run away)

line.romaji: afuredashi sou na kimochi wo hitotsu nokorazu
line.hiragana: あふれだし|そう|な|キモチ|を|ひとつ|のこらず
line.kanji: 溢れ出し|そう|な|キモチ|を|一つ|残らず
line.english: I'll gather up all my overflowing feelings
line.explained: overflowing|like|points to overflowing like|feelings|points to overflowing feelings|one|all, as in gather overflowing feelings into one

line.hiragana: ことば|に|ぜんぶ|つめこもう
line.kanji: 言葉|に|全部|詰め込もう
line.english: and put them all into words
line.explained: words|points to words|all|cram

line.hiragana: えがお|が|とまらない
line.kanji: 笑顔|が|止まらない!
line.english: I can't stop smiling
line.explained: smile|ga - used as a maker for the word before it, similar to wa but with more emphasis on the subject (See Tae Kim's Japanese guide at bottom for more info)|negative form of stop (tomaru=to stop, nai=negative part placed at end)

line.hiragana: おどる|ココロ|とまらない
line.kanji: 踊る|ココロ|止まらない!
line.english: My heart won't stop dancing
line.explained: pounding - more common use is "dance"|heart, can also mean soul|negative form of stop again

line.hiragana: うごきだす|よ|きみ|の|もと|へ
line.kanji: 動き出す|よ|君|の|元|へ
line.english: and so I start to move towards you
line.explained: begin to move|yo is a way of directing a statement at another person, like saying "I'm going to move towards you, you know"|you|no - indicates possession, most commonly associated with ('s) on the end of a word|moto - location or origin|e - can also be "he", a particle which marks a location where you or something is going, in this case, marking 'you' as the location they're heading towards

line.hiragana: はしれ！|はしれ！|はしれ！
line.kanji: 走れ!|走れ!|走れ!
line.english: and run! Run! Run!
line.explained: hashire - form of to run (hashiru) exchanging ru to re is the imperative form of the verb, telling someone to run, this is true for most verbs ending in -ru

line.romaji: ima wa mada yuuki ga tarinai!
line.hiragana: いま|は|まだ|ゆうき|が|たりない
line.kanji: 今|は|まだ|勇気|が|足りない!
line.english: Right now I don't have the courage!
line.explained: now|points to now|yet (not yet)|courage|points at courage (sentence reads at this point it's courage I don't have, with emphasis on courage)|opposite of tariru (to have enough) nai inverts it meaning not enough

line.hiragana: すこし|の|きっかけ|が|たりない
line.kanji: 少し|の|きっかけ|が|足りない!
line.english: There aren't enough little chances
line.explained: little/small|points to small|chances|points to small chances|opposite of tariru (to have enough) nai inverts it meaning not enough

line.hiragana: うごきだして|ぼく|の|からだ
line.kanji: 動き出して|僕|の|体
line.english: and so I start to move my body
line.explained: start to move|me|turns me into my (like 's)|body

line.hiragana: はしれ！|はしれ！|はしれ！
line.kanji: 走れ!|走れ!|走れ!
line.english: and run! Run! Run!
line.explained: run!|run!|run!

line.hiragana: いつだって|ふみだす|まえ|に
line.kanji: いつだって|踏み出す|前|に
line.english: Before stepping forwards I'm always
line.explained: always|stepforward|before|points to sentence in preperation for next part

line.hiragana: いいわけ|ばっかり|かんがえて
line.kanji: 言い訳|ばっかり|考えて
line.english: thinking of excuses
line.explained: excuse|always|thinking/making up

line.hiragana: けっきょく|なんにも|できなくて
line.kanji: 結局|何も|出来なくて
line.english: In the end I was unable to do anything
line.literal: in the end|nothing|not able to be done
line.explained: after all/in the end|nothing|to do (dekiru) not, negative form, *Note - in Japanese double negatives in sentances result in negatives e.g. nothing (not able to be done) ← nothing able to be done (instead of nothing that can't be done)

line.hiragana: じかん|が|すぎて
line.kanji: 時間|が|過ぎて
line.english: as time passes by me
line.explained: time|points to time|to pass (sugiru) progressive conjugation

line.hiragana: わすれていく|こと|に|なれてた
line.kanji: 忘れていく|こと|に|慣れてた
line.english: now so familiar with forgetting,
line.explained: forget about|things|points to things forgotten about|get used to (sentence reads as 'getting used to forgetting things'

line.hiragana: ぼく|の|ココロ|が|はしりだした
line.kanji: 僕|の|ココロ|が|走り出した
line.english: my heart begins to race
line.explained: me/I|turns me to my (possessive particle)|heart|points to my heart|form of hashiru (to run), means to start running

line.romaji: konna ni hiroi sekai kara sureba
line.hiragana: こんな|に|ひろい|せかい|から|すれば
line.kanji: こんな|に|広い|世界|から|すれば
line.english: Compared to this vast world
line.explained: similar to this|points to similar to this|vast/wide|world|from|in that case (sentence means 'when comparing to this vast world...'

line.hiragana: ぼく|なんて|ちっぽけ|だろう|な
line.kanji: 僕|なんて|ちっぽけ|だろう|な
line.english: someone like me seems so small
line.explained: me|like (someone like me)|small|seems|yo is used to emphasize a point and doesn't really have a meaning on it's own

line.romaji: demo kimi (h)e no boku no omoi wa
line.hiragana: でも|キミ|へ|の|ぼく|の|おもい|は
line.kanji: でも|キミ|へ|の|僕|の|想い|は
line.english: but my feelings towards you
line.explained: but|you|indicates direction (to you)|indicates possession (my [blank] towards you|me|indicates possession (my)|feelings|points to feelings towards you in preperation for next line

line.romaji: kono sora yori mo ookii kara
line.hiragana: この|そら|より|も|おおきい|から
line.kanji: この|空|より|も|大きい|から
line.english: are far greater than the sky
line.explained: this|sky|than - means more than (more than this sky)|also|big|because/since (sentence reads 'because they are bigger than the sky'

line.hiragana: えがお|が|とまらない
line.kanji: 笑顔|が|止まらない!
line.english: I can't stop smiling
line.explained: smile|ga - used as a maker for the word before it, similar to wa but with more emphasis on the subject (See Tae Kim's Japanese guide at bottom for more info)|negative form of stop (tomaru=to stop, nai=negative part placed at end)

line.hiragana: おどる|ココロ|とまらない
line.kanji: 踊る|ココロ|止まらない!
line.english: My heart won't stop dancing
line.explained: pounding - more common use is "dance"|heart, can also mean soul|negative form of stop again

line.hiragana: うごきだす|よ|きみ|の|もと|へ
line.kanji: 動き出す|よ|君|の|元|へ
line.english: and so I start to move towards you
line.explained: begin to move|yo is a way of directing a statement at another person, like saying "I'm going to move towards you, you know"|you|no - indicates possession, most commonly associated with ('s) on the end of a word|moto - location or origin|e - can also be "he", a particle which marks a location where you or something is going, in this case, marking 'you' as the location they're heading towards

line.hiragana: はしれ！|はしれ！|はしれ！
line.kanji: 走れ!|走れ!|走れ!
line.english: and run! Run! Run!
line.explained: hashire - form of to run (hashiru) exchanging ru to re is the imperative form of the verb, telling someone to run, this is true for most verbs ending in -ru

line.romaji: ima wa mada yuuki ga tarinai!
line.hiragana: いま|は|まだ|ゆうき|が|たりない
line.kanji: 今|は|まだ|勇気|が|足りない!
line.english: Right now I don't have the courage!
line.explained: now|points to now|yet (not yet)|courage|points at courage (sentence reads at this point it's courage I don't have, with emphasis on courage)|opposite of tariru (to have enough) nai inverts it meaning not enough

line.hiragana: すこし|の|きっかけ|が|たりない
line.kanji: 少し|の|きっかけ|が|足りない!
line.english: There aren't enough little chances
line.explained: little/small|points to small|chances|points to small chances|opposite of tariru (to have enough) nai inverts it meaning not enough

line.hiragana: うごきだして|ぼく|の|からだ
line.kanji: 動き出して|僕|の|体
line.english: and so I start to move my body
line.explained: start to move|me|turns me into my (like 's)|body

line.hiragana: はしれ！|はしれ！|はしれ！
line.kanji: 走れ!|走れ!|走れ!
line.english: and run! Run! Run!
line.explained: hashire - form of to run (hashiru) exchanging ru to re is the imperative form of the verb, telling someone to run, this is true for most verbs ending in -ru

line.hiragana: まっていて|も|はじまんない
line.kanji: 待っていて|も|始まんない
line.english: nothing will start if you wait
line.explained: to wait (matsu) progressive form|points to waiting|begin (hajimaru) negative, not begin

line.hiragana: キミ|と|ぜんりょく|で|むきあいたい
line.kanji: キミ|と|全力|で|向き合いたい
line.english: I want to face you with all my strength
line.explained: you|with/and|full power/all your strength|with|to face (mukau) -tai version means to want to; want to face

line.hiragana: おなじ|この|ほし|に|うまれて
line.kanji: 同じ|この|星|に|生まれて
line.english: We were born on this same planet
line.explained: same|this|planet|on|born

line.hiragana: おなじ|この|きだい|に|うまれてこれて
line.kanji: 同じ|この|時代|に|生まれてこれて
line.english: We were born in the same period of time
line.explained: same|this|period of time|on|come to be borm

line.romaji: guuzen nante kantan na kotoba de
line.hiragana: ぐうぜん|なんて|かんたん|な|ことば|で
line.kanji: 偶然|なんて|簡単|な|言葉|で
line.english: words like chance are such simple words
line.explained: chance|things like|simple|points to things like simple chances|words|points to sentence in preperation for next line

line.hiragana: すれちがい|はなれて|しまう|なんて
line.kanji: すれ違い|離れて|しまう|なんて
line.english: disagreeing and accidentally distancing ourselves
line.explained: disagreeing/having differences|distance|accidentally do/without meaning to|things like (sentence reads as having differences and accidentally distancing ourselves because of it)

line.romaji: kangaeru dake de mune no oku ga itakute
line.hiragana: かんがえる|だけ|で|むね|の|おく|が|いたくて
line.kanji: 考える|だけ|で|胸|の|奥|が|痛くて
line.english: just thinking of it hurts my chest
line.explained: thinking about|only|points to thinking about it|chest|chest's|inside|points to inside of chest|painful

line.romaji: junsui ni kimi to tsunagatteitai yo ima mo
line.hiragana: じゅんすい|に|キミ|と|つながっていたい|よ|いま|も
line.kanji: 純粋|に|キミ|と|繋がっていたい|よ|今|も
line.english: I want to get to know the real you, even now
line.explained: genuine/authentic/real|points to real|you|points to the real you|to be connected/tied together/linked to (tsunagaru) -tai makes it a wish (to want to)|*emphasis*|now|too/also

line.romaji: nan nen mo nan juunen mo kono-saki mo mirai mo
line.hiragana: なん|ねん|も|なん|じゅうねん|も|この|さき|も|みらい|も
line.kanji: 何|年|も|何|十|年|も|この|先|の|未来|も
line.english: however many years, however many decades, from now unto forever
line.explained: however many|years|too/also|however many|tens of years (decades)|too/also|from now|too/also|future|too/also

line.hiragana: いちどきり|の|じねい|だから
line.kanji: 一度きり|の|人生|だから
line.english: because we only have one chance to live
line.explained: once chance/one shot|of|life|because (sentence reads because there's only one shot at life)

line.romaji: kimi no mae ja sunao de itainda
line.hiragana: キミ|の|まえ|じゃ|すなお|で|いたいんだ
line.kanji: キミ|の|前|じゃ|素直|で|いたいんだ
line.english: I want to be honest when I'm with you
line.explained: you|your|front|points to your front|honest|points to honest in front of you|want to be

line.hiragana: それでも|こたえ|は|だせない|よ
line.kanji: それでも|答え|は|出せない|よ
line.english: even so I still can't give you an answer
line.explained: although|reply|points to 'but the reply'|negative of to give/let out|*emphasis*

line.hiragana: すこし|の|ことば|だせない|よ
line.kanji: 少し|の|言葉|出せない|よ
line.english: I can't even say the smallest of words
line.explained: small|points to small|words|negative of to give/let out

line.hiragana: きみ|が|すき
line.kanji: 「君|が|好き」
line.english: I love you
line.explained: you|points to you|like (meant as in I love you)

line.romaji: sore dake de sekai wo kaeru? kawaru?
line.hiragana: それ|だけ|で|せかい|を|かえる？|かわる？
line.kanji: それ|だけ|で|世界|を|変える?|変わる?
line.english: will those words alone change the world, will they?
line.explained: that|alone|points to that alone|world|points to [blank] alone the world [blank]|will change?|will it change?

line.hiragana: えがお|が|とまらない
line.kanji: 笑顔|が|止まらない!
line.english: I can't stop smiling
line.explained: smile|ga - used as a maker for the word before it, similar to wa but with more emphasis on the subject (See Tae Kim's Japanese guide at bottom for more info)|negative form of stop (tomaru=to stop, nai=negative part placed at end)

line.hiragana: おどる|ココロ|とまらない
line.kanji: 踊る|ココロ|止まらない!
line.english: My heart won't stop dancing
line.explained: pounding - more common use is "dance"|heart, can also mean soul|negative form of stop again

line.hiragana: うごきだす|よ|きみ|の|もと|へ
line.kanji: 動き出す|よ|君|の|元|へ
line.english: and so I start to move towards you
line.explained: begin to move|yo is a way of directing a statement at another person, like saying "I'm going to move towards you, you know"|you|no - indicates possession, most commonly associated with ('s) on the end of a word|moto - location or origin|e - can also be "he", a particle which marks a location where you or something is going, in this case, marking 'you' as the location they're heading towards

line.hiragana: はしれ！|はしれ！|はしれ！
line.kanji: 走れ!|走れ!|走れ!
line.english: and run! Run! Run!
line.explained: hashire - form of to run (hashiru) exchanging ru to re is the imperative form of the verb, telling someone to run, this is true for most verbs ending in -ru

line.romaji: ima wa mada yuuki ga tarinai!
line.hiragana: いま|は|まだ|ゆうき|が|たりない
line.kanji: 今|は|まだ|勇気|が|足りない!
line.english: Right now I don't have the courage!
line.explained: now|points to now|yet (not yet)|courage|points at courage (sentence reads at this point it's courage I don't have, with emphasis on courage)|opposite of tariru (to have enough) nai inverts it meaning not enough

line.hiragana: すこし|の|きっかけ|が|たりない
line.kanji: 少し|の|きっかけ|が|足りない!
line.english: There aren't enough little chances
line.explained: little/small|points to small|chances|points to small chances|opposite of tariru (to have enough) nai inverts it meaning not enough

line.hiragana: うごきだして|ぼく|の|からだ
line.kanji: 動き出して|僕|の|体
line.english: and so I start to move my body
line.explained: start to move|me|turns me into my (like 's)|body

line.hiragana: はしれ！|はしれ！|はしれ！
line.kanji: 走れ!|走れ!|走れ!
line.english: and run! Run! Run!
line.explained: hashire - form of to run (hashiru) exchanging ru to re is the imperative form of the verb, telling someone to run, this is true for most verbs ending in -ru
